acts.title: The Fiasco at the Finley Fair
acts.description: Your first challenge unfolds at the bustling Finley Fair, where a prized pig has mysteriously vanished. Sherlock Smythe, in a moment of unparalleled wisdom, decides the pig has learned to fly. Your task is to uncover the true thief without letting Smythe's absurd theories derail the investigation.

challenges.name: The Megaphone Misdirection
challenges.description: Sherlock Smythe is about to climb onto the main stage, megaphone in hand, ready to announce his theory of the aerial porcine to the whole Finley Fair. You must find a way to divert his attention and keep the investigation on track without revealing the true absurdity of his ideas.

challenges.name: The Silent Witness Whisperer
challenges.description: You've discovered the only witness to the pig's vanishing act is a petrified child, clinging to a tattered stuffed bear. Sherlock Smythe's wild speculations have only intensified the child's fear. It falls on you to coax the truth from the witness without frightening them further.

challenges.name: The Farmer's Watchful Eye
challenges.description: While Sherlock Smythe is busy concocting theories about avian pigs, you spy crucial evidence in the pig's pen. However, an overly suspicious farmer blocks your path, convinced everyone is out to sabotage his chances at the fair. You must find a way past him without raising alarm or suspicion.

challenges.name: The Code of the Culinary Conundrum
challenges.description: You unearthed an enigmatic note at the thief's recently deserted hideaway, but Sherlock Smythe is convinced it's a menu from a local takeaway. It's up to you to decipher the true meaning behind the cryptic symbols and track down the missing pig's whereabouts, all while humoring Smythe's culinary distraction.

challenges.name: Auction Undercover
challenges.description: As twilight descends on the fair, you've learned the thief's plan to auction the prized pig covertly. Sherlock Smythe, ever so helpfully, insists on interrogating the fair's balloon vendor about aerial pig sightings. You must navigate the fairgrounds incognito, locate the secret auction, and recover the pig without Smythe blowing your cover.

acts.title: Illusion of Intellect: The Case of the Phantom Art Heist
acts.description: You find yourself embroiled in the high-stakes world of art and deception at the illustrious Gallery Galore. A renowned painting disappeared during an exclusive gala. Sherlock Smythe is convinced the artwork has become sentient and escaped to start a new life.

challenges.name: The Enigma of Expression
challenges.description: Luckily there is a witness to the art heist. Unluckily the witness is a renowned performance artist who speaks only through their art, turning communication into a puzzle. You must unravel the meaning behind their latest piece to gather information about the stolen painting.

challenges.name: The Conundrum of the Coded Cameras
challenges.description: You realize the security footage might lead to clues about the stolen painting, but you discover it is encrypted. Sherlock Smythe is eager to “interrogate” the security system. It’s up to you to decrypt the footage before Smythe’s methods irreparably damage the evidence.

challenges.name: The Parrot's Perplexing Testimony
challenges.description: As Sherlock Smythe loudly theorizes about the painting's self-aware escape, you notice a parrot repeating snippets of conversation from the night of the heist. It's your only lead on the thief's identity, but the parrot is stressed and uncooperative amidst the chaos. You need to calm the bird and decipher the relevant clue from its babble.

challenges.name: The Secret Compartment Conundrum
challenges.description: After piecing together cryptic hints from the gala's attendees, you’ve found a hidden compartment in the gallery believed to conceal the stolen painting. However, it is securely locked with a sophisticated mechanism. Sherlock Smythe is moments away from bumbling into the scene. You need to unlock it discreetly before he claims credit or, worse, raises suspicion.

challenges.name: The Booby-Trapped Masterpiece Dilemma
challenges.description: Upon finding the painting, you discover it's rigged with a pressure-sensitive device that will shred it upon incorrect handling. You must disarm the device without alerting Sherlock Smythe or the gala attendees to avoid a scandal and save the artwork.

acts.title: The Ill-Fated Voyage
acts.description: The luxurious yacht, The Sea's Whisper, hosts a grand masquerade ball on the open sea, where a billionaire's priceless diamond goes missing. Sherlock Smythe is adamant a mermaid stole it, enchanted by its sparkle. Navigate oceanic intrigue to find the diamond while keeping Smythe's ludicrous theories afloat.

challenges.name: The Case of the Overlooked Clue
challenges.description: While ruffling through potential clues at the crime scene, Sherlock Smythe wipes his nose on a torn piece of fabric you recognize matches the attire from last night's masquerade ball. With Smythe nearly about to toss it overboard, it's up to you to ensure this crucial piece of evidence is preserved without alerting him to its importance.

challenges.name: Diving for Clues
challenges.description: While Sherlock Smythe is fixated on a mythical mermaid, you spot a suspicious guest disposing of what could be a critical clue into a shark tank. It's up to you to retrieve it without drawing too much attention or risking a swim with the sharks.

challenges.name: The Captain's Lament
challenges.description: As whispers of suspicion grow louder, you find the ship's captain in distress, victim of a cunning poison. Ensuring the safety of everyone on board, including your witless companion, hinges on your ability to concoct an antidote with what you can scrounge together aboard The Sea's Whisper.

challenges.name: The Accidental Accusation
challenges.description: As the ball continues, an overzealous security officer misconstrues Sherlock Smythe's outlandish theories as a confession, arresting him on the spot. You must now find a way to free Sherlock without revealing his incompetence or the true nature of your partnership.

challenges.name: Midnight's Thief
challenges.description: In the dead of night, you spot a shadowy figure lowering a lifeboat, diamond in hand. Sherlock Smythe, predictably, is chasing the wrong lead. It’s up to you to discreetly intervene without alerting Smythe or the guests to the real situation and ensure the thief doesn’t escape into the vast embrace of the ocean.

acts.title: Cromwell's Revenge
acts.description: The Crown Jewels have been stolen from the Tower of London, and Sherlock Smythe is convinced a ghost from English history is the culprit. It's up to you to orchestrate a plan that threads through the tight security, ancient secrets, and Smythe's wild accusations. As the tension peaks, your final test is to save the jewels, uphold Smythe's unearned reputation, and perhaps, change the course of history.

challenges.name: Spectral Misdirection
challenges.description: As night falls over the Tower of London, Sherlock Smythe is convinced a ghost stole the Crown Jewels. You need to conjure a "ghost" to keep Smythe and the guards distracted while you investigate the real theft.

challenges.name: Traps of the Past
challenges.description: Upon discovering a secret passage that could reveal the route of the thief, you encounter a series of ancient traps. Your knowledge of historical engineering is the only thing standing between you, the truth about the Crown Jewels, and safeguarding Sherlock Smythe's undeserved reputation.

challenges.name: Echoes of Power
challenges.description: After deducing the jewels’ location, you face a room sealed by technology centuries ahead of its time - it opens only to the voice of Cromwell. Without the correct timbre and accent, the history and your ruse are lost. You must find a cunning workaround to replicate Cromwell's voice and gain entry.

challenges.name: The Great Escape
challenges.description: In a catastrophic blunder, Sherlock Smythe has activated the Tower's ancient lockdown mechanism, imprisoning both of you within its stone walls. You have a scant few moments before the security team arrives, and it's up to you to find a way out without exposing both your whereabouts and Smythe's incompetence.

challenges.name: The Final Step
challenges.description: The Crown Jewels lie before you, gleaming under the moonlit breach in the Tower of London's walls. However, they are set upon a pressure-sensitive floor that will trigger a bomb if a single misstep is made. Sherlock Smythe is moments away from lumbering forward, drawn like a moth to the flame. It's up to you to navigate the safe path and retrieve the jewels without Smythe's clumsy interference or the world discovering his ineptitude.

shopText:
###Stocking up

It would be responsible to prepare yourself for the day. You can afford **<|count|>** items.
rumors: Fair fiasco unfolds: vanished swine, child's tears, farmer's glare, cryptic note mystery, and clandestine auction. Will the genius or guise prevail?
Decode artist's silence, unveil encrypted shadows, heed the parrot's whisper, unlock secrets silently, and defuse art's imminent demise.
Masquerade mishaps, perilous pools, poisoned captains, wrongful arrests, and midnight marauders await in the curious cruise of Sherlock Smythe.
Spectral whispers, ancient traps lurk, power echoes' riddle, trapped by history's design, a final, dangerous step under moon's watchful eye.

Candy.text: You attempted to lure Sherlock away from the stage with the prospect of his favorite candy, forgetting his recent vow to avoid sweets before speeches to "enhance vocal clarity." Sherlock, unwavering in his new practice, ignored the candy and proceeded with the aerial porcine announcement.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: As you slipped the noise-cancelling headphones over Sherlock Smythe's ears, hoping to drown out the crowd's anticipation, he mistook the gesture for a signal that his voice needed to be louder and proceeded to shout his absurd theory through the megaphone with even more vigor.

Fake mustache.text: You quickly distract Sherlock Smythe by suggesting a mysterious figure in the crowd is the elusive "Whiskered Witness," known only by their distinguished mustache. Excited, Sherlock rushes off to find this non-existent figure, giving you time to correct the course of the investigation.

Notebook.text: You quickly jot down a note about a crucial, made-up clue in the notebook and wave it at Sherlock Smythe, claiming it's from an anonymous informant. Intrigued and distracted from his absurd theory, he abandons the megaphone to discuss the new lead with you.

Sticky notes.text: You quickly jot down a series of fake, urgent leads on the sticky notes and plaster them along Sherlock Smythe's path to the stage, leading him away on a wild goose chase around the fairgrounds, away from the megaphone and the crowd's expectant ears.

Costume.text: You quickly don the costume of the fair's mascot, a giant porcupine, and signal for Sherlock's attention. Curious, he follows you, away from the stage, intrigued by this unexpected encounter, thereby avoiding the disastrous announcement.

Invisible ink pen.text: Your plan was to quickly write a more sensible theory with the invisible ink pen on Sherlock Smythe's notes, hoping it would magically appear during his speech. Unfortunately, Sherlock Smythe, with his flair for the dramatic, bypassed his notes entirely, opting to speak from the heart, leaving your invisible ink unused and your plan foiled.

Lollipop.text: In an attempt to divert Sherlock Smythe's attention, you presented the lollipop as a crucial piece of evidence that required immediate analysis. Unfortunately, Sherlock took one look at the lollipop, declared it a 'clear symbol of the sugar conspiracy,' and proceeded to use it as a prop in his megaphone announcement about aerial porcine at the Finley Fair.

Tape.text: You discreetly use the tape to attach the megaphone's speaking end to its amplifying cone, ensuring the absurd theory of aerial porcine stays unheard over the loud buzz of muffled malfunction as Sherlock Smythe attempts to speak.

Lock pick set.text: As Sherlock Smythe hoisted the megaphone, ready to proclaim his theory, you decided to use your lock pick set to discretely jam the megaphone, hoping to buy some time. Unfortunately, the only things you succeeded in jamming were the tools in the lock pick set itself, snapping the tension wrench in the process. The megaphone blared, undeterred.

Magnifying glass.text: You discreetly flashed the magnifying glass in the sunlight, hoping to catch Sherlock Smythe's attention and draw him away from the stage. Unfortunately, he mistook the reflected light for a clue and became even more excited to share his aerial porcine theory, convinced it was a sign of affirmation from the universe.

Pocket mirror.text: You attempt to use the pocket mirror to create a distracting glint of sunlight, hoping to catch Sherlock's attention and redirect him away from the stage. Unfortunately, Sherlock, intrigued by his own reflection, snatches the mirror to admire his "detective's intuition" face, leaving you without your diversion and him more confident than ever.

Map.text: In an attempt to divert Sherlock's attention, you show him the map, suggesting a crucial clue lies in a specific location marked on it. However, Sherlock, misunderstanding your intention, takes the map and, using the megaphone, begins to explain to the crowd his theory on how the map's layout proves the existence of aerial porcine, only deepening the crowd's confusion and your embarrassment.

Voice recorder.text: You secretly recorded a faux message from the Queen, praising Sherlock Smythe for his discretion and urging him to keep the aerial porcine theory confidential until royal experts could review it. Playing it just before his stage appearance, you watched with relief as Sherlock, swelling with unearned pride, decided the stage was no place for such "royally recognized" genius.

Disguise kit.text: Using the disguise kit, you quickly threw together an outfit to impersonate the fair's director, urgently calling Sherlock Smythe aside for a "private consultation" on the aerial porcine theory. This diversion allowed time to refocus his sleuthing senses onto a more plausible lead while preserving his eccentric reputation.

Flashlight.text: In an attempt to divert Sherlock Smythe's attention away from his ludicrous aerial porcine theory, you flashed the flashlight in his eyes just before he stepped onto the stage. Unfortunately, rather than diverting his attention, the bright light only startled him, causing him to stumble forward and, in his disorientation, proclaim his theory into the megaphone with even more gusto.

Smartphone.text: You quickly dialed the number of the local radio station, convincing them to cut into the fair's broadcast with an urgent "breaking news" segment about a famous celebrity sighting on the opposite end of the fairgrounds. Sherlock, ever eager for the limelight, hurried off with his megaphone to investigate, leaving the case in your capable hands.

Binoculars.text: You handed Sherlock Smythe the binoculars, suggesting he scope out suspicious characters from afar instead of using the megaphone. He immediately used them backwards, loudly complaining that everyone in the fair had suddenly shrunk, further embarrassing himself before he even reached the stage.

Decoy flyer.text: You quickly handed Sherlock the decoy flyer, which advertised a lecture on the revolutionary "Theory of Aerial Porcine" happening at the exact same time as his speech. Intrigued and flattered that someone else had come to the same groundbreaking conclusion, Sherlock dashed off to join the non-existent lecture, leaving you to steer the investigation back on course without his disruptive theories.

Dog treat.text: Attempting to distract Sherlock with the dog treat, you throw it aside, only for it to be caught effortlessly by a vigilant dog show participant's well-trained Pomeranian, leaving Sherlock's disastrous announcement unabated.

Candy.text: You offer a piece of candy to the child, promising it as a gentle reward for sharing their story. The sweet treat not only calms the child but also earns their trust, allowing you to collect the vital testimony while Sherlock Smythe bumbles in the background, none the wiser to your clever tactic.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: You place the noise-cancelling headphones over the child's ears, cutting off the sound of Sherlock's nonsensical theories. In the newfound silence, you communicate with the child through simple gestures and written notes, easing their fears and eventually coaxing out the crucial details of the pig's vanishing act without further traumatizing them.

Fake mustache.text: In an attempt to appear less intimidating and more amusing to the child, you don the fake mustache. Unfortunately, your sudden transformation bewilders the child even more, convincing them that people's faces can change at will, plunging them into a deeper silence out of fear.

Notebook.text: You carefully drew pictures of the incident, asking the child to point and nod instead of speaking. This approach, combined with Sherlock's outlandish theories scribbled in the margins as harmless doodles, eased the child's fears and encouraged them to reveal crucial details about the pig's mysterious disappearance without a word.

Sticky notes.text: You created a game with the sticky notes, allowing the child to write down what they saw instead of speaking it, making the process feel safe and like a playful activity. This eases the child's fear and teases the crucial information out of them without direct interrogation, keeping Sherlock Smythe blissfully unaware of your technique.

Costume.text: In an attempt to appear less intimidating and more playful, you donned the costume, aiming to cheer up the child. Unfortunately, the sight of an adult abruptly transforming into a large, unidentified creature only deepened the child’s terror, causing them to retreat further into silence.

Invisible ink pen.text: Trying to engage the child's imagination, you used the invisible ink pen to write secret messages meant to coax them into communication. Unfortunately, the thrill was lost on them as they could not see the ink appear on the paper without the revealing light, making the whole exercise moot and leaving the child more puzzled than engaged.

Lollipop.text: You gently offered the lollipop to the child, using its sweetness as an icebreaker. As the child's initial apprehension eased, they began to share what they saw, allowing you to piece together the clues without Sherlock's chaotic theories scaring them further.

Tape.text: In an attempt to make a gentle, calming recording for the child, you accidentally played a tape of Sherlock Smythe's latest far-fetched theories instead, which only exacerbated the child's fear.

Lock pick set.text: In an attempt to appear resourceful and gather evidence, you tried using the lock pick set to open an old, rusted chest you thought might hold clues in the child's home. However, not only did you fail to pick the lock, but you also jammed your tools in the process, drawing attention to your less-than-legal methods and further frightening the witness with your suspicious behavior.

Magnifying glass.text: You tried to use the magnifying glass to find clues on the tattered bear, hoping to encourage the child to speak by showing interest in their toy. However, the magnification of the lens scared the child further, making them believe you were going to "burn" their only comfort with the intense, focused light.

Pocket mirror.text: In an attempt to distract the child from Sherlock's blundering theories, you used the pocket mirror to catch light and create playful patterns on the wall. However, this only made the child more upset, mistakenly believing it was some sort of phantom trying to communicate, thereby worsening the situation.

Map.text: In a misguided effort, you unfold the map in an attempt to distract and engage the child, proposing an imaginary hunt for the vanished pig. Unfortunately, your plan backfires as the child, already overwhelmed by Sherlock Smythe's theories, becomes even more confused and scared by the irrelevant geographical details, retreating further into silence.

Voice recorder.text: You suggested to the child that they could speak into the voice recorder as if they were telling the story to the stuffed bear, rather than the intimidating presence of Sherlock Smythe. The child, finding comfort in the familiar object and the simplicity of the task, recounted the critical details of the pig's disappearance, allowing you to solve the case discreetly.

Disguise kit.text: In an attempt to seem less intimidating, you applied the disguise kit to transform Sherlock Smythe into what you thought was a friendly, non-threatening figure. Unfortunately, your decision to turn him into a giant, walking teddy bear only succeeded in terrifying the child further, associating the traumatic event with a childhood toy gone horribly wrong.

Flashlight.text: In an attempt to create a soothing atmosphere, you decided to dim the lights and use the flashlight to project comforting shapes onto the wall. However, your shadow puppetry inadvertently cast large, looming shadows across the room, resembling the very monster from Sherlock Smythe's outlandish theories, further terrifying the child.

Smartphone.text: You used the smartphone to play gentle, soothing music that calmed the child down. Once more at ease, you showed them a simple drawing app, encouraging the child to express what they saw during the pig's disappearance through digital art.

Binoculars.text: In an attempt to use the binoculars to observe the child from a distance and deduce any overlooked clues, you inadvertently caught Sherlock's attention, who, mistaking them for a new gadget, snatched them and began a nonsensical lecture on "long-distance emotional analysis." The child, further spooked by Sherlock's antics, retreated further into silence.

Decoy flyer.text: In an attempt to divert Sherlock Smythe's attention and give yourself some space with the child, you presented the decoy flyer anticipating it might catch Sherlock's fancy. Unfortunately, his scrutiny was too brief, quickly deeming it irrelevant to the case, shifting his bumbling interference back to the terrified witness, leaving your efforts in vain.

Dog treat.text: Attempting to use the dog treat to coax the child into talking only resulted in awkward silence, as it turns out, a treat meant for dogs does little to comfort a scared child holding a teddy bear.

Candy.text: Attempting to use the candy as a bribe, you underestimate the farmer's determination to protect his prize pigs from any perceived threats, including sugar highs pre-fair. He promptly confiscates the candy, chastising you for attempting to harm his livestock's chances.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: As you put on the noise-cancelling headphones, planning to ignore the farmer's protests, you find that they do nothing to diminish his visibility or his determination to physically block your path to the pig’s pen.

Fake mustache.text: You quickly affix the fake mustache under your nose, transforming your appearance just enough to approach the farmer with a new identity. Claiming to be an inspector from the Regional Agricultural Fair, you express concern over potential sabotage, convincing him to give you a moment alone in the pig pen to "inspect" for threats.

Notebook.text: Hoping to distract the farmer, you presented your notebook, claiming to be a judge for a secret competition at the fair. Unfortunately, the farmer, recognizing the notebook's mundane appearance, dismissed your bluff and became even more wary of your intentions.

Sticky notes.text: Attempting to distract the farmer by sticking notes with bizarre accusations around his barn only served to make him more paranoid and convinced that you were indeed the saboteur he'd feared.

Costume.text: You choose the perfect moment to slip into a costume of a fair judge, convincing the farmer you were there for a pre-fair inspection. His ambition for winning the fair overcame his suspicion, allowing you to investigate the pig's pen unhindered.

Invisible ink pen.text: Attempting to sneak past the farmer using the invisible ink pen to divert his attention elsewhere, you quickly realize the flaw in your plan: the farmer is too fixated on you and the animals, making your subtle messages on penned notes invisible to him as well. Without a direct distraction, your efforts to pass unnoticed fail miserably.

Lollipop.text: Attempting to distract the farmer with the lollipop, you underestimated his disdain for sweets, leading him to become even more paranoid about your intentions.

Tape.text: Believing you could distract the farmer by creating a sticky situation elsewhere, you attempted to use the tape to fashion a make-shift tripwire between two trees. Unfortunately, your plan backfired when the tape proved too visible and flimsy, leading the farmer directly to you as he went to investigate this amateurish sabotage, further fueling his suspicions.

Lock pick set.text: While Sherlock distracted the farmer with his ludicrous theories, you used your lock pick set to quietly unlock the gate to the pig's pen, slipping inside to gather the evidence unnoticed.

Magnifying glass.text: In your attempt to use the magnifying glass to spot clues in the pig pen from afar, the sun's rays reflected off the glass, catching the farmer's attention and raising his suspicion even further, as he mistook it for some high-tech sabotage gadget.

Pocket mirror.text: In an attempt to distract the farmer, you threw the pocket mirror towards the pig's pen, hoping to catch the sunlight and divert his attention. However, the mirror landed with a soft thud in the mud, unnoticed by the farmer but leaving you without your reflective tool.

Map.text: In an attempt to distract the farmer, you show him the map, suggesting a treasure might be buried on his land, aiming to send him on a wild goose chase. Unfortunately, he quickly realizes the map is of a completely different region and accuses you of trying to trick him, becoming even more suspicious of your motives.

Voice recorder.text: In an attempt to distract the farmer, you played sounds of a looming storm from the voice recorder. Unfortunately, this only made him more protective of his pig and more suspicious of your intentions, as he couldn't figure out where the sudden storm sounds were coming from and spotted the device in your hand.

Disguise kit.text: You quickly donned an inconspicuous outfit from your disguise kit, transforming into a fellow farmer seeking advice on prize-winning livestock. The skeptical farmer, seeing a peer rather than a prying detective's assistant, relaxed and allowed you access to the pigs' pen without a second thought.

Flashlight.text: In an attempt to distract the farmer, you shone the flashlight across his eyes, momentarily blinding him. However, this only made him more paranoid, leading him to accuse you of being a thief and firmly escort you off his property.

Smartphone.text: You quickly pull up an online farming forum and engage the farmer in a discussion about his prized techniques for raising award-winning pigs, distracting him long enough to sneak past and snag the evidence from the pen.

Binoculars.text: Attempting to use the binoculars to scout the evidence in the pig's pen from a distance, you accidently catch the farmer's eye reflection. This causes him to grow even more suspicious, stalking towards you with a stern "What exactly are you spying at?".

Decoy flyer.text: You casually drop the decoy flyer detailing a faux farming award near the farmer. Intrigued by the potential prestige, he momentarily abandons his post to investigate, allowing you unobstructed access to the pig's pen and the evidence within.

Dog treat.text: Spotting the farmer's dog languishing under the hot sun, you nonchalantly toss the dog treat in its direction, instantly winning its affection. The grateful dog beelines for you, providing the perfect distraction as the farmer rushes over to retrieve his now overly enthusiastic pet, allowing you to slip past undetected.

Candy.text: In an attempt to use the candy to bribe a local informant for information, Sherlock Smythe intercepted the exchange, mistaking the sweet treats for evidence of the so-called "takeaway" menu, and devoured the lot before a single clue could be gleaned.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: While trying to concentrate on deciphering the note with your noise-cancelling headphones on, you missed Sherlock Smythe's misguided, yet crucial clue shouted over his shoulder – a clue that could have led you directly to the pig's location hidden in plain sight at the local food festival.

Fake mustache.text: In an attempt to distract Sherlock Smythe from his menu musings, you donned the fake mustache pretending to be a culinary critic who challenged his interpretations. However, Smythe, ever so proud, spent hours debating food theory with you, further delaying the case resolution and leading nowhere near the missing pig or the note's true meaning.

Notebook.text: You meticulously compared the cryptic symbols in the note to your extensive collection of documented codes and symbols within your notebook. By cross-referencing these symbols with historical criminal patterns you've noted down over the years, you cleverly decipher the message, locating the missing pig at an abandoned farmhouse, while Sherlock Smythe was distracted trying to order what he thought was an exotic dish from the "menu."

Sticky notes.text: Attempting to use the sticky notes to mark potential clues on the cryptic symbols, you underestimated Sherlock Smythe's ability to become distracted by anything resembling food. He mistook your carefully placed sticky notes for his own annotations on "new and exotic dishes" he wanted to try, hopelessly scattering them as he animatedly planned his hypothetical feast.

Costume.text: In an effort to decipher the cryptic note, you dressed up in the costume, hoping to infiltrate a group of local chefs believed to be connected to the thief, only for Sherlock to loudly declare that the costume made you look exactly like the sous chef from his favorite restaurant, thereby alerting everyone to your presence and ruining the element of surprise.

Invisible ink pen.text: You applied the invisible ink pen to the note, revealing a hidden message beneath the seemingly innocent symbols, detailing the location of the missing pig. Meanwhile, Sherlock Smythe remained oblivious, still engrossed in what he believed was an exotic menu.

Lollipop.text: In a far-fetched attempt to coax meaning from the cryptic note, you gave Sherlock the lollipop to "sweeten" his analytical skills. Unfortunately, he took it literally, sucking on the candy while offering no useful insights, leaving the note's puzzle unsolved and the lollipop thoroughly consumed.

Tape.text: Believing the symbols might align with the ridges and patterns found on various tape rolls, you try to match the code to the adhesive side of your tape. Despite your hopeful efforts, tape proves too generic and flexible to align precisely with the intricate symbols, leaving the note's secrets uncracked and Smythe salivating over imaginary dishes.

Lock pick set.text: You skillfully used the lock pick set to open a locked drawer in the thief's hideaway, revealing a cipher key for the note. The key translated the cryptic symbols into coordinates for the missing pig's location, all while Sherlock Smythe debated between Kung Pao chicken and crispy duck.

Magnifying glass.text: Using the magnifying glass, you scrutinized the enigmatic note and discovered that the "menu" items aligned with street names around the city, guiding you to the thief's new hideout and the missing pig, all while Sherlock Smythe drooled over imaginary dishes.

Pocket mirror.text: Attempting to use the pocket mirror to reflect light onto the note and reveal hidden ink, you instead catch Sherlock Smythe's attention with the glint. Enthralled, he snatches the mirror to admire his own reflection, leaving the note unexamined and the true meaning undiscovered.

Map.text: By comparing the symbols on the enigmatic note with landmarks and streets on your map, you discovered that the cryptic symbols corresponded to a specific route leading to a nondescript warehouse, where you found the missing pig and a plethora of stolen goods. While Sherlock Smythe was busy debating the merits of kung pao chicken versus sweet and sour pork, you quietly led the police to the criminal's hideout.

Voice recorder.text: In an effort to record Smythe's humorous misconceptions for later analysis, you accidentally played back previous recordings of you meticulously explaining past cases and solutions in your own voice, while Smythe was within earshot. This near miss not only failed to progress the case but also risked revealing your true role as the brains behind the operations.

Disguise kit.text: You used the disguise kit to masquerade as a chef at the local takeaway that Sherlock Smythe obsesses over, gaining access to the kitchen where you discovered the note was indeed a thieving gang's coded message, cleverly disguised as a menu. Returning to your role as assistant, you subtly nudged Smythe toward the truth without revealing your culinary caper.

Flashlight.text: In an attempt to reveal hidden inks or secret messages, you shone the flashlight on the cryptic note, hoping for a eureka moment. Unfortunately, the light only highlighted Sherlock Smythe's excited scribbles about potential sides and sauces, further convincing him of the menu theory.

Smartphone.text: Utilizing the smartphone, you quickly snapped a picture of the cryptic note and used an app designed for decrypting coded messages. Remarkably, it revealed the locations of several high-profile culinary establishments, each symbol representing a different restaurant, and the missing pig was traced back to an exclusive farm-to-table bistro known for its pork dishes. Meanwhile, Sherlock Smythe remained blissfully unaware, believing his culinary theory had merit.

Binoculars.text: While attempting to use the binoculars to scout distant rooftops for clues, you instead catch Sherlock Smythe using them to peer into a local bakery, exclaiming about the "clues" in the form of pastries, further distracting from the case at hand.

Decoy flyer.text: Attempting to divert Smythe's attention with the decoy flyer, he instead became utterly fixated on the faux menu's special dish, "The Enigmatic Eggplant," and insisted on visiting the non-existent restaurant to try it, leading you both further away from solving the case.

Dog treat.text: You thought the dog treat might contain a clue if fed to the thief's guard dog, perhaps making the dog reveal a hidden item or location. Unfortunately, Sherlock Smyithe suggested it was a sample from the supposed "takeaway menu," took a tentative bite, and declared it lacked seasoning, utterly missing the point and leading nowhere.

Candy.text: In an attempt to discretely gather information from the fair attendees, you offered candy as a friendly bribe for information. Unfortunately, Sherlock Smythe intervened, loudly proclaiming, "Brilliant idea! Sweets for secrets!" drawing unwanted attention and scaring off potential informants.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: While wearing the noise-cancelling headphones to avoid detection, you missed the crucial whispers between the thief and the auctioneer pointing the way to the secret auction, leading you to wander in circles until the pig was sold.

Fake mustache.text: As you adjusted the fake mustache in an attempt to blend in, a gust of wind from the nearby cotton candy machine sent it fluttering away, leaving you exposed just as the auctioneer recognized you from earlier investigations.

Notebook.text: As you scribbled notes, attempting to look casual, Smythe's loud inquiries led the auctioneer's cronies directly to you. In your hasty retreat, you dropped the notebook, leaving a trail of hastily written pig sketches and investigative leads.

Sticky notes.text: Planning to use the sticky notes to mark potential auction sites discreetly, you underestimated the wind's strength at the fair. The notes caught air and flew chaotically around the fair, leading Sherlock Smythe to chase after them, believing they were coded messages from the thief, thus drawing undue attention to your investigation.

Costume.text: You adeptly donned the costume of a local farmhand, blending seamlessly into the fair's crowd. This disguise allowed you to eavesdrop on hushed conversations, leading you directly to the covert auction and facilitating the pig's recovery without drawing any suspicion to yourself or Smythe.

Invisible ink pen.text: While attempting to write down the auction's details with your invisible ink pen, you realized too late that without a UV light, you couldn't verify what you had written, leading to a mix-up in the location and time of the auction.

Lollipop.text: Believing it could be used as a disguise, you attempted to stick the lollipop to the front of your shirt, posing as a fair vendor. However, Sherlock Smythe, spotting the lollipop, bounded over excitedly, snatched it from your shirt, and proceeded to question you loudly about the "spectacular aerial pig".

Tape.text: You used the tape in an attempt to affix a makeshift disguise for entry into the auction, but the adhesive failed to hold onto the fabric under the fair's lighting, leading to your cover being blown before even finding the auction.

Lock pick set.text: Using the lock pick set, you discreetly unlock a covert door hidden behind a carnival game booth, finding the secret pig auction taking place in a makeshift barn. Your subtle entry ensures Sherlock Smythe's antics with the balloon vendor go unnoticed, allowing you to bid, win back the prized pig, and escape undetected.

Magnifying glass.text: In your focused effort to use the magnifying glass to inspect small clues around the fairgrounds, Sherlock Smythe, in a moment of overzealous assistance, grabs it to examine a “suspicious” candy wrapper, barks excitedly about a non-existent clue, and clumsily drops it, shattering the lens on the gravel path.

Pocket mirror.text: In an attempt to use the pocket mirror to discreetly observe the crowd for the thief, you inadvertently catch the setting sun's rays, casting an obvious, roving spotlight across fairgoers. This draws undue attention and Smythe, believing it to be a signal from the thief, loudly proclaims he's deciphered the code, blowing your cover instantly.

Map.text: Using the map, you quickly found a discreet path to the auction location, avoiding areas where Smythe's antics could draw attention to himself or you. By sticking to less traveled routes, you blended in with the crowd, reached the auction, and successfully outbid the thief under the guise of a local farmer, all while Smythe was debating the likelihood of airborne swine with an increasingly perplexed balloon vendor.

Voice recorder.text: You tried to record the auctioneers incriminating themselves but accidentally played a previous recording of Smythe's theories on aerial pig flight, alerting the thieves to your presence.

Disguise kit.text: Using the disguise kit, you transformed yourself into a nondescript fair attendee, blending seamlessly with the crowd. This allowed you to overhear whispers about the auction's location from unsuspecting thieves, leading you straight to the prized pig without drawing attention from Sherlock Smythe or anyone else.

Flashlight.text: As you switched on your flashlight to scan the dim corners of the fair for the secret auction, Sherlock Smythe, mistaking its beam for a signal from the supposed aerial pig thieves, drew all attention to you both by loudly proclaiming he'd decoded their plot, inadvertently alerting the thief, who promptly canceled the auction.

Smartphone.text: Using the smartphone, you quickly set up a fake auction alert on a popular fairground app, baiting the thief to change the location to a spot you've pre-selected. While Smythe is busy with the balloon vendor, you discreetly monitor the thief's movements through the app and nab the prized pig during the hastily rearranged auction, all without raising suspicion.

Binoculars.text: From a discreet location, you use your binoculars to scan the fairgrounds, spotting a group of suspicious individuals entering a hidden tent behind the ferris wheel. You follow them quietly and recover the prized pig without alerting Smythe or the thieves to your true intentions.

Decoy flyer.text: You cleverly distribute the decoy flyer around the fair, advertising a fake auction location. This misleads both Smythe and potential troublemakers away from the real auction, allowing you to sneak in undetected and recover the prized pig without a hitch.

Dog treat.text: In an attempt to distract Sherlock Smythe with the dog treat, you inadvertently attracted the attention of every dog in the fairgrounds, causing chaos and leading Smythe directly to the secret auction with his new canine entourage.

Candy.text: Hoping to engage the performance artist on a sensory level, you offer them the candy as a symbol of sweetness missing from the scene of the crime. However, they incorporate the candy into their art as a commentary on the ephemeral nature of truth, ignoring your questions entirely.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: You put on the noise-cancelling headphones, expecting to filter out distractions and focus on the artist's silent message. However, as the artist began their performance, you realized that the essential clues were embedded in the ambient sounds of the room, which were now inaudibly muted by your headphones.

Fake mustache.text: In an attempt to communicate with the performance artist, you don a fake mustache hoping it might be recognized as a symbol of disguise or hidden truths. Unfortunately, the artist, seeing it as a mockery of their art, refuses to perform, leaving you with no new information about the art heist.

Notebook.text: You sketched the enigmatic performance and noted every detail it conveyed. Upon analyzing your comprehensive notes and sketches, key symbols linked back to an obscure art movement known to influence the thief, thus revealing their next target.

Sticky notes.text: You carefully placed sticky notes on various parts of the performance artist's latest piece, labeling patterns and seemingly connected sections with your observations, guesses, and deductions. Slowly, the sticky notes formed a makeshift map of logic that led to the revelation of a cryptic message indicating the location of the stolen painting. Sherlock Smythe, under your guidance, marveled at the piece and your 'collaborative interpretation', maintaining his image as a sharpest detective mind.

Costume.text: You decided to wear the costume hoping to blend in with the artist's avant-garde troupe. Unfortunately, the artist took your appearance as a critical mockery of their work, refusing to communicate further and leaving you with more questions than answers.

Invisible ink pen.text: Attempting to communicate with the performance artist, you used the invisible ink pen to draw supplementary symbols on the margins of their artwork, hoping they'd respond in kind. However, the artist, seeing their work tampered with, became incensed and refused to engage further, seeing your addition as vandalism rather than communication.

Lollipop.text: You hoped offering the lollipop to the performance artist might encourage them to break their silence. Instead, they incorporated it into their performance, treating it as a symbol of consumerism's naïveté, leaving you no closer to deciphering their message about the heist.

Tape.text: You tried to use the tape to outline the abstract shapes of the performance artist's piece, hoping it would form a recognizable pattern or clue. Unfortunately, Sherlock Smythe stumbled over it, becoming entangled in a mess of tape and abstract art, which only served to confuse matters further.

Lock pick set.text: In an overzealous moment, you decided to use the lock pick set to crack open the frame of the performance artist's cryptic sculpture, hoping it contained secret compartments with clues. Unfortunately, the lock picks proved useless on the solid, welded shut metal frame, doing nothing but scratching the surface and raising suspicion.

Magnifying glass.text: Using the magnifying glass, you scrutinized the performance artist's latest piece, a dense collage of newsprint and paint. You discovered a hidden pattern of letters and numbers, cleverly integrated into the artwork, revealing the time and location of the art heist meeting.

Pocket mirror.text: In attempting to communicate with the performance artist, you hold up the pocket mirror to reflect their art back at them, hoping for a revelation. Instead, they interpret this as a simplistic critique of vanity and shallowness in art, leading them to close off any further attempts at communication.

Map.text: In a burst of misguided inspiration, you assumed the map could correlate geographic locations referenced in the performance artist's piece to the site of the art heist, only to discover the piece was purely abstract, rendering the map utterly irrelevant.

Voice recorder.text: You played a recording of the sounds present during the artist's performance, capturing the ambient noise, their movements, and any unintentional vocalizations. Later, by analyzing the recording, you deciphered key auditory clues that matched certain elements in the stolen painting's description, effectively "translating" the artist's performance into valuable witness testimony.

Disguise kit.text: You used the disguise kit to mimic the performance artist's style and persona, gaining their trust and encouraging them to express the details of the heist through a collaborative art piece that spelled out the perpetrator's identity.

Flashlight.text: In an attempt to decipher the performance artist's intentions, you shine your flashlight on their latest piece, hoping to uncover hidden details. However, the artist interprets the beam of light as part of an unsolicited collaboration, incorporating it into their ongoing performance, which only muddles the message further and leaves you no closer to understanding the theft.

Smartphone.text: You use your smartphone to record a video of the performance artist's latest piece, then utilize various social media platforms and art forums to crowdsource interpretations of the artwork, quickly gathering diverse insights which lead you to the stolen painting's location.

Binoculars.text: You tried to use the binoculars to get a closer look at the performance artist's latest piece from a distance, hoping to avoid direct interaction. Unfortunately, the details were too abstract up close, rendering them useless for deciphering the artwork's hidden message.

Decoy flyer.text: Attempting to use the decoy flyer to attract the performance artist's attention, you find they're entirely absorbed in their art, unfazed by your attempts to lure them away for a conversation. The artist's focus remains unbroken, rendering the flyer ineffective.

Dog treat.text: You try offering the dog treat to the performance artist, hoping it might break the ice or somehow inspire them to communicate more directly. Unfortunately, the artist merely incorporates the treat into their performance, leaving its meaning as enigmatic as ever, without providing any clues about the heist.

Art supplies.text: You used the art supplies to create your own piece that visually asked questions about the heist. The performance artist responded with a new work, revealing the location of the stolen painting.

Screwdriver.text: In an attempt to "unlock" the meaning behind the performance artist's latest piece, you tried to use the screwdriver on the installation, mistakenly thinking it could be disassembled for clues. The artist was not amused, and neither was the gallery owner. Instead of clues, you got a stern lecture on the sanctity of art and a ban from the venue.

Digital camera.text: You used the digital camera to document the performance artist's latest work, capturing both broad shots and intricate details. By reviewing the photos, you recognized a recurring motif that matched the missing painting's description, leading you to understand the artist's clues about the heist's location and method.

Birdseed.text: You scatter birdseed on the performance artist's latest installation, hoping to attract birds that might symbolically reveal the piece's meaning. Instead, the birds chaos ensues, obscuring the art and leaving you no closer to understanding the witness's testimony about the heist.

Mirror.text: You presented the mirror to the artist, hoping it would reflect some hidden clue in their artwork. However, the artist, inspired by your action, incorporated the mirror into their piece, misinterpreting your intention as a contribution rather than an inquiry, leaving you clueless and the mirror part of an avant-garde sculpture.

Pencil.text: You skillfully sketch the art in front of you, using the pencil to mirror the witness's abstract forms. By presenting it back to them, you encourage a dialogue where the artist points out discrepancies and directs you toward clues hidden in the original artwork's nuances.

Translation app.text: As Sherlock Smythe pompously boasted about his "innovative" approach, you quietly aimed your translation app at the performance artist, hoping for verbal clues. However, the app, designed for speech-to-text in known languages, sputtered in confusion at the abstract gestures and symbolic visuals, failing to provide any coherent insight into the case.

Laptop.text: You use the laptop to track down the performance artist's past exhibitions and reviews, identifying patterns and themes in their work. This deep dive into their artistic history provides crucial insights, allowing you to decode the meaning behind their latest piece and thus indirectly extracting the information about the stolen painting's whereabouts.

Blanket.text: You draped the blanket over the performance artist's latest enigmatic sculpture, hoping it would reveal hidden clues like a UV light might expose invisible ink. Instead, the artist took it as a critique of their work, wrapping themselves in the blanket and refusing to communicate further.

Headphones.text: You played an array of calming music through the headphones, hoping to create an atmosphere conducive to artistic expression. Unfortunately, the performance artist interpreted this as a critique of their silence, incorporating the headphones into a new, enigmatic sculpture that provided no clues.

Candy.text: In an attempt to sweeten the deal, you offered the candy to the security guard in hopes of gaining easier access to the encryption software. Unfortunately, the security guard was on a strict diet and saw through the ruse, leading to a lecture on healthy eating instead of useful information.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: You put on the noise-cancelling headphones to block out Sherlock Smythe's nonsensical babbling about "intuitive interrogation techniques" for electronics. In a bubble of silence, you concentrate, quickly deciphering the encryption on the security footage without interruption.

Fake mustache.text: In an attempt to distract Smythe, you slapped the fake mustache on the security panel, hoping he'd interrogate it instead. Smythe, however, mistook it for a top-secret facial recognition feature and bashed the panel trying to "coax it into talking," further encrypting the footage.

Notebook.text: Using your notebook, you quickly jot down the visible patterns and sequences from the security system's interface, before Sherlock Smythe can enact his plan of "enhanced interrogation" on the hardware. Your prior experience with similar encryption methods allows you to manually decode the footage, revealing a shadowy figure making off with the painting.

Costume.text: You tried using the costume to impersonate the security system's technician, hoping to access the encrypted footage without Smythe's interference. However, Smythe decided to "assist" the technician, revealing your disguise in the process and rendering the attempt futile.

Invisible ink pen.text: In an attempt to reveal hidden messages you thought the thief might have left on the security footage, you used the invisible ink pen on the computer screen, mistakenly believing it would work like a blacklight. Instead, it just left a permanent, glaring streak across the display, rendering it even harder to analyze the encrypted footage.

Lollipop.text: In a misguided attempt to use the lollipop to soothe Smythe's eagerness, you offer it to him, hoping to distract. Unfortunately, it only boosts his sugar levels, leading to an even more frenzied attempt at "interrogating" the security system, while the encrypted footage remains untouched and unchanged.

Tape.text: In an attempt to impress, you tried using the tape to manually cover the security system's sensors, hoping it would somehow trigger a reset and decrypt the footage. However, all you managed was to further confuse the system, causing it to lock down completely and erase the last 12 hours of backup footage, including any lead you had on the painting.

Lock pick set.text: While Sherlock Smythe loudly threatened the "devious digital villain" for its silence, you used one of the thinner lock picks to carefully remove the casing around the encrypted hard drive, allowing you direct access to the motherboard. From there, you could bypass the encryption directly by short-circuiting the security protocol.

Magnifying glass.text: In an attempt to decrypt the footage, you placed the magnifying glass over the computer screen, hoping to reveal hidden details or encryption keys. Instead, Sherlock Smythe, mistaking your method for a breakthrough, grabbed the glass, pressing it against the screen and loudly proclaiming his "genius." The screen showed nothing but larger pixels, no closer to solving the encryption puzzle, while Smythe’s enthusiasm resulted in a scratched lens and a confused investigation team.

Pocket mirror.text: While you tried reflecting the deciphering screen's glow onto the encrypted footage with your pocket mirror, hoping to somehow reveal hidden messages or disrupt the encryption, all it did was catch Sherlock Smythe's attention. Intrigued and utterly confused, he grabbed the mirror to "enhance" his interrogation techniques, shattering it against the security system in his enthusiasm.

Map.text: In a moment of desperation, you unfurled the map, hoping its intricate streets and alleys could somehow mirror the digital encryption pattern. Unfortunately, your attempt to draw parallels between the physical layout of the city and the coded footage only confused Smythe further, leading him to spill his cup of Earl Grey on the precious document, rendering it unreadable and entirely irrelevant to breaking the encryption.

Voice recorder.text: In an attempt to use the voice recorder to play back any audio clues potentially embedded within the encrypted files, you accidentally pressed "record" instead of "play," thereby overwriting crucial sounds that might have been extracted with mere silence and the mumbling of Sherlock Smythe theorizing about alien involvement.

Disguise kit.text: In an attempt to distract Smythe, you use the disguise kit to disguise yourself as the security system's technician. However, Smythe becomes overly enthusiastic about "assisting" the technician and ends up hitting the system with a magnifying glass, believing it would magnify the encryption keys, causing irreparable damage before you can decrypt anything.

Flashlight.text: As Sherlock Smythe prepares to "interrogate" the security system in his unique way, you shine the flashlight on the security panel, revealing hidden fingerprints on the keypad. This allows you to deduce the password sequence from the most frequently touched keys, thus decrypting the footage without Smythe's catastrophic intervention.

Smartphone.text: Using your smartphone, you quickly download a user-friendly decryption app that's highly rated for amateur sleuthing. While Sherlock Smythe distractedly fawns over his reflection in a nearby mirror, you discreetly upload the encrypted security footage onto the app. Minutes later, the footage is decrypted, revealing a clear image of the thief in action, all without Sherlock’s harmful “interrogation” of the security system.

Binoculars.text: In an optimistic bid, you aimed the binoculars at the encrypted footage displayed on the monitor, hoping to spot some overlooked detail that might hint at the encryption key. However, peering through binoculars at a digital screen only blurred the pixels, rendering the cryptic clues even more indecipherable and leaving Sherlock Smythe to poke haphazardly at the keyboard in confusion.

Decoy flyer.text: You attempted to distract Sherlock Smythe by planting the decoy flyer as a false lead, only for him to use it as a makeshift fan to cool down the overheating computer he was interrogating, further delaying the decryption process.

Dog treat.text: Attempting to distract Sherlock with the dog treat while you decrypt the footage proved futile. Sherlock, misunderstanding your intentions, thought you had discovered a "culinary clue" and proceeded to eat the treat himself, declaring it lacked seasoning but could be a vital clue. This did not aid in decrypting the security footage.

Art supplies.text: In an act of desperation, you tried to use the art supplies to create a plausible fake of the stolen painting, hoping to fool Smythe and buy some time. However, he immediately tried to use a paintbrush to "enhance" the security system's interface, causing a short circuit and erasing the footage.

Screwdriver.text: You use the screwdriver to delicately remove the hard drive from the security system, allowing you to bypass the encryption by connecting it directly to your laptop. This avoids the digital booby traps Sherlock Smythe would have undoubtedly triggered.

Digital camera.text: Using the digital camera, you took high-quality photographs of the security monitor displaying the encrypted footage. Then, you cleverly used the camera’s playback zoom feature to closely examine and decode the visible encryption pattern piece by piece, bypassing the need to directly interact with the security system and avoiding Sherlock Smythe's chaotic "interrogation" tactics.

Birdseed.text: You sprinkled birdseed on the security system's keyboard, hoping pigeons might peck out the decryption code by chance. Instead, the birds simply made a mess with no useful input, and Sherlock Smythe almost exposed your ploy by attempting to interview the pigeons as "key witnesses."

Mirror.text: In an attempt to decipher the encrypted footage, you positioned the mirror to catch and reflect the screen's glow, hoping to reveal hidden messages through reversed imagery. However, Sherlock Smythe, mistaking your innovative approach for a moment of vanity, snatched the mirror to check his own reflection, only to drop and shatter it in his clumsy excitement.

Pencil.text: As you attempted to scribble down potential decryption keys, Sherlock Smythe, in his usual overzealous manner, mistook your doodles for an ancient script that "only the most seasoned detectives could decipher", proceeding to snatch the pencil and scribble nonsense all over your notes, rendering them and any hopes of a quiet decryption useless.

Translation app.text: You use the translation app on your smartphone to decipher the cryptic symbols overlaying the security footage, uncovering the timestamp and camera angles that show the thief in action before Smythe can "interrogate" the wiring.

Laptop.text: While Sherlock Smythe busied himself with a magnifying glass and the DVR, you utilized your laptop to run decryption software on the security footage, revealing the thief's identity without alerting Smythe to your technological interference.

Blanket.text: In a desperate bid to prevent Smythe from "interrogating" the security system, you draped the blanket over the security monitors, hoping somehow it would magically decrypt the footage. Alas, not only did this not work, but Smythe, in his confusion, tripped over the blanket and fell into the monitors, breaking them and further complicating the investigation.

Headphones.text: In an attempt to decode the encrypted footage, you plug the headphones into the computer, hoping to use a sonification method to interpret the data audibly. However, the complex encryption on the footage only produces an indecipherable cacophony of sounds, leaving you no closer to a solution and Sherlock Smythe banging on the keyboard in frustration.

Candy.text: You offered the parrot a piece of candy, which it accepted eagerly, the sugar helping to soothe its nerves. As it nibbled contentedly, the parrot's ramblings became clearer, revealing a crucial clue: the thief's frequent use of a unique code phrase.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: Placing the noise-cancelling headphones over the parrot's head only served to confuse the bird further, causing it to squawk louder without offering any coherent clues.

Fake mustache.text: In an attempt to appear less threatening to the parrot, you don the fake mustache, hoping to look like a different, less intimidating person. Sadly, the parrot, far from being calmed, becomes even more agitated, screeching about "strange faces" and "tickly feathers," rendering it impossible to extract any useful information.

Notebook.text: You used the notebook to jot down the parrot's repeated phrases, isolating relevant clues from its babble by cross-referencing them with the case details you already knew. This methodical approach calmed the parrot as it focused on the task, helping you deduce the thief's identity without stressing the bird further.

Sticky notes.text: In an attempt to calm the parrot and differentiate relevant words from its babble, you stick notes on the cage, color-coded for each snippet of dialogue you deem important. Unfortunately, the parrot, already stressed, becomes further agitated by the sticky notes invading its space and shreds them to pieces before any sense can be made of its ramblings.

Costume.text: In a misguided attempt to put the parrot at ease, you donned the costume, hoping to resemble a giant, friendly bird. Unfortunately, the sight of a human-sized parakeet only terrified the parrot further, causing it to squawk incoherently before falling silent, eyeing you warily from its perch.

Invisible ink pen.text: Hoping to communicate with the parrot discreetly, you scribble potential phrases on scraps of paper with your invisible ink pen. Unfortunately, the chaotic environment makes it impossible to shine a UV light without drawing Sherlock's immediate, bumbling attention, rendering the pen's utility null in this scenario.

Lollipop.text: You use the lollipop to coax the parrot into a more receptive and calm state, allowing it to focus on mimicking the relevant parts of the conversation it overheard, thus bypassing its stress-induced refusal to cooperate.

Tape.text: In hopes of coaxing the parrot into repeating the crucial clue without the stress of Sherlock Smythe's wild theorizing, you gently unroll the tape, intending to create a quiet, focused environment by sealing off the area. However, as you press the first strip of tape around the perimeter, Sherlock, with his usual flair for the dramatic, barrels into the scene, entangling himself in the sticky side. In his struggle, he not only scares the parrot into silence but also manages to wrap both of you in a cocoon of adhesive, rendering the tape useless and leaving the parrot's testimony forever a mystery.

Lock pick set.text: In a misguided attempt to use the lock pick set to dismantle the parrot's cage for a less stressful environment, you only managed to jab and startle the bird further, causing it to screech unintelligibly and retreat to the furthest corner of its cage.

Magnifying glass.text: In your attempt to analyze the parrot with the magnifying glass, hoping it might reveal some hidden detail or clue, you only succeeded in further startling the already distressed bird, causing it to screech nonsensically and flap away to the farthest corner of the room, far from your reach and, more importantly, far from helping the case.

Pocket mirror.text: Attempting to use the pocket mirror to calm the parrot, you unwittingly catch a beam of sunlight, which frightens the bird further, causing it to fly into a closed window and then retreat into silence, refusing to speak any further.

Map.text: In a desperate attempt to calm the bird and coax out useful snippets, you unfold the map, hoping its vast display might distract and settle the creature. However, the parrot, far from calmed, becomes fixated on the bright colors and tears the map to shreds with its beak in a frenzied attempt to find something it recognizes.

Voice recorder.text: You played back earlier snippets of conversations recorded on your voice recorder, finding segments that were calm or featured Sherlock Smythe's less ludicrous moments. This familiar, somewhat reassuring audio helped soothe the parrot, making it more willing to repeat the crucial clues from the night of the heist without the stress of Smythe's current theories.

Disguise kit.text: In an attempt to calm the parrot, you decided to use the disguise kit to make yourself appear less threatening, perhaps as a familiar figure. However, your transformation into what you believed was the bird's previous owner only served to confuse and further stress the parrot, making it squawk frantically about "strange faces" and "intruders," thus adding to the chaos rather than alleviating it.

Flashlight.text: In a misguided attempt to calm the parrot, you flashed the light directly at it, only causing further stress and scattering its feathers everywhere. The bird screeched louder, completely ignoring your attempts to listen for clues.

Smartphone.text: You played a series of calming bird songs you found on a nature app on your smartphone, which relaxed the parrot enough to repeat a crucial snippet: "The window, midnight." This led you to discover a secretly used entry point by the thief.

Binoculars.text: In an attempt to use the binoculars to observe the parrot from a safe distance, hoping to spot any clues in its behavior without stressing it further, you only succeed in bumping into furniture and drawing unwanted attention, without gaining any useful insight from the bird's distant figure.

Decoy flyer.text: In an attempt to calm the parrot, you waved the decoy flyer within view, hoping to grab its attention. Unfortunately, the flyer, featuring an advertisement for a tropical paradise, only agitated the bird further as it started squawking louder, craving the unreachable landscapes.

Dog treat.text: As you attempt to offer the dog treat to the parrot, it squawks disdainfully and turns away. Parrots prefer fruits and nuts, not meat-based treats designed for dogs.

Art supplies.text: Believing art might soothe the parrot, you laid out the supplies to paint a calming seascape. Unfortunately, the parrot, uninterested in artistic endeavors, squawked disdainfully and scattered the paints with a flap of its wings, ruining any chance of calming it down with art.

Screwdriver.text: In a moment of misguided ingenuity, you attempted to use the screwdriver to disassemble the cage, thinking it might relax the parrot. However, the bird, already on edge, perceived this as a threat and became even more agitated, squawking loudly and flying to the far side of the room, far out of your reach.

Digital camera.text: You attempt to use the digital camera to record the parrot, hoping to analyze its words later. Unfortunately, the flash scares the parrot further, causing it to retreat into silence and ignore your attempts to coax it back out.

Birdseed.text: You offer the birdseed to the parrot, which quickly calms down as it eats. Amidst its content munching, it repeats a key phrase heard on the night of the heist, leading you closer to the thief's identity.

Mirror.text: In an effort to calm the parrot, you present the mirror, hoping its own reflection might soothe it. Instead, the bird, agitated further by "another parrot" invading its space, screeches louder, flapping wildly, and ultimately, the mirror slips from your grip, shattering on the ground.

Pencil.text: Attempting to calm the parrot, you sketch its portrait with the pencil, hoping mimicry might soothe it. Instead, the bird, offended by the amateur attempt, screeches louder, snatches the pencil with its beak, and flings it out of the window.

Translation app.text: As you aim the translation app at the squawking parrot, you quickly discover it's calibrated for human languages, not avian chatter, rendering it useless in deciphering the bird's fragmented phrases.

Laptop.text: You attempted to play soothing bird sounds on the laptop to calm the parrot; however, Sherlock Smythe, thinking the laptop was a clue box and trying to "assist," clumsily spilled his cup of tea all over it, frying the electronics before the parrot could even react to the sounds.

Blanket.text: You draped the blanket over the cage, creating a makeshift night environment that calmed the parrot down, allowing it to focus and repeat the thief's distinct catchphrase clearly, without the stress of its surroundings.

Headphones.text: In trying to play soothing music to the parrot through the headphones, you discovered they only work on human ears, not avian anatomy, making them entirely ineffective at calming the bird.

Candy.text: In a desperate bid, you try to use the candy to bribe a nearby gala attendee, hoping they have insight into the lock mechanism. Unfortunately, the attendee scoffs at the offer of candy as a bribe, leaving you red-faced as Sherlock Smythe stumbles onto the scene.

Noise-cancelling headphones.text: As you put on the noise-cancelling headphones, hoping to concentrate on the mechanism’s subtle clicks, you fail to hear Sherlock Smythe's loud entrance, which distracts the gala attendees and draws unwanted attention to your discreet efforts at the hidden compartment, thus complicating your task further.

Fake mustache.text: You quickly affix the fake mustache on your face, assuming the guise of a renowned locksmith invited to the gala. Approaching the gallery's security, you convincingly argue that you've been summoned to address a "faulty lock" situation regarding a very "valuable piece." Your improvised disguise buys you just enough time to utilize your lock-picking skills on the hidden compartment, opening it before Sherlock Smythe arrives, thus averting his potential mishap without arousing suspicion.

Notebook.text: As you frantically flip through your notebook, searching for any notes on decoding locks or hidden mechanisms, Sherlock Smythe stomps in, tripping over an ornate rug and crash-lands beside you, drawing everyone's attention including yours, causing you to miss the critical detail scribbled in the margin.

Sticky notes.text: In an attempt to use the sticky notes to either decipher or leave a trail marking which combination attempts had been made, you quickly realize the sticky notes refuse to adhere to the metallic surface of the safe, fluttering to the ground uselessly as Sherlock Smythe steps into the room, eyes alight with unwarranted confidence.
